input:
Fred was supposed to run the dishwasher, but he put it off, because he wanted to watch TV. But the show turned out to be boring, so he changed his mind and turned it on. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The dishwasher
(B) The TV

Look! There is a shark swimming right below that duck! It had better get away to safety fast! What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The shark
(B) The duck

Look! There is a minnow swimming right below that duck! It had better get away to safety fast! What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The minnow
(B) The duck

The scientists are studying three species of fish that have recently been found living in the Indian Ocean. They began two years ago. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) The scientists
(B) The fish

The table won't fit through the doorway because it is too wide. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The table
(B) The doorway

The trophy doesn't fit into the brown suitcase because it is too small. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) the trophy
(B) the suitcase

Joan made sure to thank Susan for all the help she had recieved. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Joan
(B) Susan

The man lifted the boy onto his shoulders. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) The man
(B) The boy

Sam tried to paint a picture of shepherds with sheep, but they ended up looking more like dogs. What does the pronoun "they" refer to?
(A) The shepherds
(B) The sheep

Mary took out her flute and played one of her favorite pieces. She has loved it since she was a child. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The flute
(B) The piece
